content.name: European Whirl

notes.productNote:
* Travel to Europe often requires an overnight flight. Please arrange flights to arrive on or before Day 1. 
* NEW Netherlands Health & Safety Regulation: Employees cannot carry luggage heavier than 23kg/50lbs. If the guests luggage exceeds the limit, guests must carry their own luggage to/from their room from the coach.
* Day 1: This trip starts in London. Guests have a free day to explore the city at their leisure.
* Day 3:  Meet your Travel Director before boarding the Eurostar to Brussels and a coach journey to Amsterdam.
* Day 14: Transfers to Paris Charles de Gaulle Airport will arrive at 8AM.  
* Day 14 - Complimentary London Return: Guests are welcome to return to London by Trafalgar motor coach. Additional accommodations will be required as arrival in London will be late afternoon/early evening. 
* NOTRE DAME:  Due to the fire earlier this year, travel groups no longer visit the inside of Notre Dame but guests may still have the chance to view it from the outside.
* Drinking Water: Tap water is safe to drink in all of the destinations on this trip. Please remember to bring a water bottle.

content.description: The tring-tring of Dutch bicycles launches your Europe adventure, from picture-perfect Amsterdam and vine-clad hills along the Rhine with its medieval castles, to the open-air museum that is Rome.

highlights.title: Sightseeing Highlights
items: ORIENTATION of Amsterdam, Heidelberg, Innsbruck, Venice and Lucerne
VISIT St. Peter's Basilica in Rome
VIEW the canals in Amsterdam, the Golden Roof in Innsbruck, St. Mark's Square in Venice, the ancient sites in Rome, the Chapel Bridge in Lucerne and the Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris
SEE the Lorelei Rock and the vineyards of Burgundy
SCENIC CRUISE along the canals of Amsterdam and the Rhine River

whatsIncluded.title: Dining Highlights
items: 13 breakfasts
1 lunch (Be My Guest)
4 dinners

whatsIncluded.title: First class travel Highlights
items: Audio Headsets for flexible sightseeing
Daily breakfast and up to half your evening meals
Luxury air-conditioned coach with Wi-Fi in most countries or alternative transportation (such as rail journeys)
The services of a Trafalgar Local Host at your London hotel
Cherry-picked hotels, all tried and trusted
Optional Experiences and free time
All porterage and restaurant gratuities
Must-see sightseeing and surprise extras
An expert Travel Director and professional Driver
All hotel tips, charges and local taxes
Eurostar high-speed train from London to Brussels
London airport transfer service is available to purchase. Conditions apply. See airport transfer page for details
Pick-up if you stay at the Trafalgar recommended London hotel, booked through Trafalgar, or from the London Reception Centre
Handcrafted Highlights
VIP entry to many sights

itinerary.title: Arrive London (2 Nights)
text: Welcome to the vibrant British capital where you will spend the next two nights, enjoying the pomp and pageantry of a city that effortlessly combines old and new.

itinerary.title: London Sightseeing and Free Time
text: Join a 'Local Specialist' this morning for a tour of the iconic and unexpected sites of London.

itinerary.title: London – Eurostar™ – Brussels – Amsterdam
text: This morning we meet our Travel Director before travelling to London's St. Pancras International where we will board the Eurostar™ for a high-speed train journey to Brussels and a luxury coach journey to Amsterdam. Enjoy an orientation of this historic Dutch city before joining your fellow travellers and Travel Director for a Welcome Reception dinner cruise on its canals.

itinerary.title: Amsterdam – Rhine Cruise – Heidelberg – Rhineland
text: Driving through the lush landscapes of The Netherlands and Germany, we arrive in Boppard where we board a cruise along the Rhine to St. Goar, passing vineyard-clad hills and medieval castles perched above riverside towns. Arriving in the Baroque city of Heidelberg, we explore its iconic and unexpected highlights before travelling to our Rhineland hotel.

itinerary.title: Rhineland – Innsbruck
text: We cross the Austrian border next, arriving in Innsbruck, the capital of the Alps. Admire the Gothic, Renaissance and Baroque architecture of the Old Town, including Emperor Maximilian's famous Golden Roof with its ornate façade. Admire the fascinating crystal installations and browse for precious gifts and souvenirs at the Swarovski Crystal Worlds Store and consider an evening of traditional Tyrolean entertainment.

itinerary.title: Innsbruck – Venice
text: Journey through the emerald-green landscape along the Brenner Pass into Italy and across the Dolomite Mountains to Venice. We cruise the beautiful Venetian lagoon by private launch to the gateway of Venice, St. Mark's Square. View the ornate Doge's Palace and the Bridge of Sighs, so named for the sound made by condemned prisoners as they took one last longing look at their beautiful city before meeting their fate. Then, 'Dive Into Culture' and witness the centuries-old craft of Venetian glassblowing before spending the afternoon at leisure to soak up the romantic atmosphere. Get lost in Venice, cross bridges and discover hidden campi where locals share their daily stories over a glass of Venetian Spritz.

itinerary.title: Venice – Rome (2 Nights)
text: Travel south across the Veneto Plain, passing Bologna and the dramatic Apennine Mountains as well as the green and golden fields of Lazio before reaching Rome, the Eternal City. En route, we 'Connect with Locals' over a 'Be My Guest' lunch and enjoy true Tuscan hospitality with a local family on their private estate in the Chanti countryside.

itinerary.title: Rome Sightseeing and Free Time
text: Our first stop today sees us discover the divine beauty of the Vatican City. We'll visit St. Peter's Basilica with a 'Local Specialist' to view Michelangelo's Renaissance masterpiece, the Pietà. We continue to ancient Rome to view the iconic Colosseum and Circus Maximus, once the site of exhilarating chariot races centuries ago. The afternoon is yours to explore the city on your terms. Sit on the Spanish Steps savouring a tasty gelato, shop up a storm on the trendy Via Corso or perhaps join an Optional Experience to see the magnificent frescoed ceiling of the Sistine Chapel.

itinerary.title: Rome – Florence Sightseeing
text: From Rome, we travel north through the rolling countryside of Tuscany and along the Arno valley to the 'Cradle of the Renaissance', Florence. Delve into the rich Medici heritage of this beautiful medieval city with your 'Local Specialist'. Visit what was once the political hub of the city, Piazza della Signoria, with its impressive sculptures and stunning palazzi. View the imposing Duomo with its Brunelleschi dome and Baptistery renowned for its bronze doors filled with relief sculptures.

itinerary.title: Florence – Lucerne (2 Nights)
text: Drive via the scenic Italian Lakes District, across the Alps into beautiful Switzerland, where we'll spend the next two nights in the medieval lakeside city of Lucerne in one of Trafalgar's 'Stays With Stories' - the Grand Hotel Europe, with its century-old history.

itinerary.title: Lucerne Orientation and Free Time
text: This morning, view the mournful, mortally wounded lion hewn from rock to commemorate the Swiss Guards who lost their lives defending Louis XVI. Walk along the flower-lined 14th-century covered Chapel Bridge, crossing the Reuss. Or join an exciting Optional Experience to one of the surrounding peaks for breathtaking views of the Swiss countryside. We have some time later to discover the best Swiss chocolates in town.

itinerary.title: Lucerne – Paris (2 Nights)
text: Crossing the border into France this morning, we travel past the picturesque vineyards and country towns of Burgundy en route to the City of Light. Spend some time this evening strolling along the Seine and grand boulevards in search of a cosy bistro for fine French cuisine or consider an Optional Experience to a colourful Parisian cabaret.

itinerary.title: Paris Sightseeing and Free Time
text: Join a 'Local Specialist' today for a sightseeing tour of this romantic city. View the sophisticated Champs Élysées, Place de la Concorde and the 19th-century Arc de Triomphe, honouring those who fought for France, Notre Dame Cathedral, then enjoy a stroll through the Latin Quarter. Our European Whirl almost at its end, we spend the evening with fellow travellers and our Travel Director, enjoying a Farewell Dinner in a local bistro.

itinerary.title: Depart Paris
text:
After breakfast, we say a fond au revoir to your fellow travellers and Travel Director. An airport transfer is available. Conditions apply.

Complimentary London Return - guests are welcome to return to London by Trafalgar motor coach at no extra cost. Additional accommodation will be required as arrival in London will be late afternoon/early evening. Please speak to your Travel Agent about this at time of booking.

content.name: European Whirl

notes.productNote:
To take advantage of our Presale Price Guarantee and enjoy 2021 trips at 2020 prices, book by September 15, 2020.  If the prices of our 2020 Europe & Britain Trips go up, we'll honour the lower presale period pricing. If prices go down, we'll refund you the difference.
Payment and Cancellation fees falls under Level 1

Our European Whirl almost at its end, we spend the evening with fellow travellers and our Travel Director, enjoying a Farewell Dinner in a local bistro.

itinerary.title: Paris – Eurostar™ – London
text: Transfers are provided to Paris Gare du Nord station, where you’ll board the Eurostar™ train to London. The journey time to London St. Pancras International is 2 hours and 20 minutes. On arrival in London, you are met and transferred to your hotel.

itinerary.title: Depart London
text: Enjoy an English breakfast at the end of your holiday.

text: Drive via the scenic Italian Lakes District, across the Alps into beautiful Switzerland, where we'll spend the next two nights in the medieval lakeside city of Lucerne in one of Trafalgar's 'Stays With Stories' - the Grand Hotel Europe, with its century-old history.

itinerary.title: Lucerne Orientation and Free Time
text: This morning, view the mournful, mortally wounded lion hewn from rock to commemorate the Swiss Guards who lost their lives defending Louis XVI. Walk along the flower-lined 14th-century covered Chapel Bridge, crossing the Reuss. Or join an exciting Optional Experience to one of the surrounding peaks for breathtaking views of the Swiss countryside. We have some time later to discover the best Swiss chocolates in town.

itinerary.title: Lucerne – Paris (2 Nights)
text: Crossing the border into France this morning, we travel past the picturesque vineyards and country towns of Burgundy en route to the City of Light. Spend some time this evening strolling along the Seine and grand boulevards in search of a cosy bistro for fine French cuisine or consider an Optional Experience to a colourful Parisian cabaret.

itinerary.title: Paris Sightseeing and Free Time
text: Join a 'Local Specialist' today for a sightseeing tour of this romantic city. View the sophisticated Champs Élysées, Place de la Concorde and the 19th-century Arc de Triomphe, honouring those who fought for France, Notre Dame Cathedral, then enjoy a stroll through the Latin Quarter. Our European Whirl almost at its end, we spend the evening with fellow travellers and our Travel Director, enjoying a Farewell Dinner in a local bistro.

itinerary.title: Paris – Eurostar™ – London
text: Transfers are provided to Paris Gare du Nord station, where you’ll board the Eurostar™ train to London. The journey time to London St. Pancras International is 2 hours and 20 minutes. On arrival in London, you are met and transferred to your hotel.

itinerary.title: Depart London
text: Enjoy an English breakfast at the end of your holiday.

content.name: European Whirl with Eurostar™ Extension

notes.productNote:
* Travel to Europe often requires an overnight flight. Please arrange flights to arrive on or before Day 1. 
* Autumn, Winter, Spring Departures: Prices, discounts, itinerary, and hotels are subject to change and will be finalized when the Autumn, Winter, Spring Europe Brochure is released in May 2020.
* NEW Netherlands Health & Safety Regulation: Employees cannot carry luggage heavier than 23kg/50lbs. If the guests luggage exceeds the limit, guests must carry their own luggage to/from their room from the coach.
* Day 1: This trip starts in London. Guests have a free day to explore the city at their leisure.
* Day 3:  Meet your Travel Director before boarding the Eurostar to Brussels and a coach journey to Amsterdam.
* Day 14 - Eurostar Extension: Transfers are provided to Paris Gare du Nord station. Travel onboard the Eurostar train to London St. Pancras International station. Upon arrival in London transfers are provided to the hotel.
* Day 15:  Depart London at your leisure.* NOTRE DAME:  Due to the fire earlier this year, travel groups no longer visit the inside of Notre Dame but guests may still have the chance to view it from the outside.
* Drinking Water: Tap water is safe to drink in all of the destinations on this trip. Please remember to bring a water bottle.

content.description: The tring-tring of Dutch bicycles launches your Europe adventure, from picture-perfect Amsterdam and vine-clad hills along the Rhine with its medieval castles, to the open-air museum that is Rome.

highlights.title: Sightseeing Highlights
items: SIGHTSEEING TOUR with a Local Specialist in London, Rome, Florence and Paris
ORIENTATION of Amsterdam, Heidelberg, Munich, Innsbruck, Venice and Lucerne
VISIT St. Peter's Basilica in Rome and the Latin Quarter in Paris

VIEW the canals in Amsterdam, the Town Hall in Munich, the Golden Roof in Innsbruck, St. Mark's Square in Venice, the ancient sites in Rome, the Chapel Bridge in Lucerne and the Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris
SEE the Lorelei Rock, the vineyards of Burgundy and the Somme Battlefields
SCENIC CRUISE along the canals of Amsterdam and the Rhine River

whatsIncluded.title: Dining Highlights
items: 14 breakfasts
1 lunch (Be My Guest)
4 dinners

whatsIncluded.title: First class travel Highlights
items: Audio Headsets for flexible sightseeing
Daily breakfast and an average of 50% of evening meals
Luxury air-conditioned coach with WiFi in most countries or alternative transportation (such as rail journeys)
The services of a Trafalgar Local Host if you stay at your London hotel
Cherry-picked hotels, all tried and trusted
Optional Experiences and free time
All porterage and restaurant gratuities
Must-see sightseeing and surprise extras
An expert Travel Director and professional Driver
All hotel tips, charges and local taxes
Hand-picked Trip Highlights

itinerary.title: Arrive London (2 Nights)
text: Welcome to the vibrant British capital where you will spend the next two nights, enjoying the pomp and pageantry of a city that effortlessly combines old and new.

itinerary.title: London Sightseeing and Free Time
text: Join a 'Local Specialist' this morning for a tour of the iconic and unexpected sites of London.

itinerary.title: London – Eurostar™ – Brussels – Amsterdam
text: A brief interlude with the British capital this morning sees us meet our Travel Director before travelling to London's St. Pancras International where we will board the Eurostar™ for a high-speed train journey to Brussels and a luxury coach journey to Amsterdam. Enjoy an orientation of this historic Dutch city before joining your fellow travellers and Travel Director for a Welcome Reception dinner cruise on its canals.

itinerary.title: Amsterdam – Rhine Cruise – Heidelberg
text: Driving through the lush landscapes of The Netherlands and Germany, we arrive in Boppard where we board a cruise along the Rhine to St. Goar, passing vineyard-clad hills and medieval castles perched above riverside towns. Arriving in the Baroque city of Heidelberg, we explore its iconic and unexpected highlights.

itinerary.title: Heidelberg – Munich – Innsbruck
text: Crossing the Swabian Alps on the edge of the Black Forest, we arrive in the Bavarian capital of Munich. Our orientation takes us past the Olympic Stadium and neo-Gothic Town Hall, which dominates the Marienplatz. We cross the Austrian border next, arriving in Innsbruck, the capital of the Alps. Admire the Gothic, Renaissance and Baroque architecture of the Old Town, including Emperor Maximilian's famous Golden Roof with its ornate façade and consider an evening of traditional Tyrolean entertainment.

itinerary.title: Innsbruck – Venice
text: Journey through the emerald-green landscape along the Brenner Pass into Italy and across the Dolomite Mountains to Venice. We cruise the beautiful Venetian lagoon by private launch to the gateway of Venice, St. Mark's Square. View the ornate Doge's Palace and the Bridge of Sighs, so named for the sound made by condemned prisoners as they took one last longing look at their beautiful city before meeting their fate. Then, 'Dive Into Culture' and witness the centuries-old craft of Venetian glassblowing before spending the afternoon at leisure to soak up the romantic atmosphere. Get lost in Venice, cross bridges and discover hidden campi where locals share their daily stories over a glass of Venetian Spritz.

itinerary.title: Venice – Rome (2 Nights)
text: Travel south across the Veneto Plain, passing Bologna and the dramatic Apennine Mountains as well as the green and golden fields of Lazio before reaching Rome, the 'Eternal City'. En route, we 'Connect with Locals' over a 'Be My Guest' lunch and enjoy true Tuscan hospitality with a local family on their private estate in the Chanti countryside.

itinerary.title: Rome Sightseeing and Free Time
text: Our first stop today sees us discover the divine beauty of the Vatican City. We'll visit St. Peter's Basilica with a 'Local Specialist' to view Michelangelo's Renaissance masterpiece, the Pietà. We continue to ancient Rome to view the iconic Colosseum and Circus Maximus, once the site of exhilarating chariot races centuries ago. The afternoon is yours to explore the city on your terms. Sit on the Spanish Steps savouring a tasty gelato, shop up a storm on the trendy Via Corso or perhaps join an Optional Experience to see the magnificent frescoed ceiling of the Sistine Chapel.

itinerary.title: Rome – Florence Sightseeing
text: From Rome, we travel north through the rolling countryside of Tuscany and along the Arno valley to the 'Cradle of the Renaissance', Florence. Delve into the rich Medici heritage of this beautiful medieval city with your 'Local Specialist'. Visit what was once the political hub of the city, Piazza della Signoria, with its impressive sculptures and stunning palazzi. View the imposing Duomo with its Brunelleschi dome and Baptistery renowned for its bronze doors filled with relief sculptures.

itinerary.title: Florence – Lucerne (2 Nights)
text: Drive via the scenic Italian Lakes District, across the Alps into beautiful Switzerland, where we'll spend the next two nights in the medieval lakeside city of Lucerne.

itinerary.title: Lucerne Orientation and Free Time
text: This morning, view the mournful, mortally wounded lion hewn from rock to commemorate the Swiss Guards who lost their lives defending Louis XVI. Walk along the flower-lined 14th-century covered Chapel Bridge, crossing the river Reuss. Or join an exciting Optional Experience to one of the surrounding peaks for breathtaking views of the Swiss countryside. We have some time later to discover the best Swiss chocolates in town.

itinerary.title: Lucerne – Paris (2 Nights)
text: Crossing the border into France this morning, we travel past the picturesque vineyards and country towns of Burgundy en route to the 'City of Light'. Spend some time this evening strolling along the Seine and grand boulevards in search of a cosy bistro for fine French cuisine or consider an Optional Experience to a colourful Parisian cabaret.

itinerary.title: Paris Sightseeing and Free Time
text: Join a 'Local Specialist' today for a sightseeing tour of this romantic city. View the sophisticated Champs Élysées, Place de la Concorde and the 19th-century Arc de Triomphe, honouring those who fought for France, Notre Dame Cathedral then enjoy a stroll through the Latin Quarter. Our European Whirl almost at its end, we spend the evening with fellow travellers and our Travel Director, enjoying a Farewell Dinner in a local bistro.

itinerary.title: Paris – Eurostar™ – London
text: Transfers are provided to Paris Gare du Nord station, where you'll board the Eurostar™ train to London. The journey time to London St. Pancras International is 2 hours and 20 minutes. On arrival in London, you are met and transferred to your hotel.

itinerary.title: Depart London
text: Enjoy an English breakfast at the end of your holiday.

content.name: European Whirl

notes.productNote:
* Travel to Europe often requires an overnight flight. Please arrange flights to arrive on or before Day 1. 
* Autumn, Winter, Spring Departures: Prices, discounts, itinerary, and hotels are subject to change and will be finalized when the Autumn, Winter, Spring Europe Brochure is released in May 2020.
* NEW Netherlands Health & Safety Regulation: Employees cannot carry luggage heavier than 23kg/50lbs. If the guests luggage exceeds the limit, guests must carry their own luggage to/from their room from the coach.
* Day 1: This trip starts in London. Guests have a free day to explore the city at their leisure.
* Day 3:  Meet your Travel Director before boarding the Eurostar to Brussels and a coach journey to Amsterdam.
* Day 14: Transfers to Paris Charles de Gaulle Airport will arrive at 8AM.  
* Day 14 - Complimentary London Return: Guests are welcome to return to London by Trafalgar motor coach. Additional accommodations will be required as arrival in London will be late afternoon/early evening. 
* NOTRE DAME:  Due to the fire earlier this year, travel groups no longer visit the inside of Notre Dame but guests may still have the chance to view it from the outside.
* Drinking Water: Tap water is safe to drink in all of the destinations on this trip. Please remember to bring a water bottle.
